body.p: I have been laid up at my office in town with a frost-bitten footContracted shortly before 21 Feb; actually inflammation of the joints, presumably gout: see To Forster, [3 Mar 65], Pilgrim Letters 11, p. 23. (consequent on too much walking in snow), and received your kind note of invitation only this morning. I hasten to thank you for it, and to explain my seeming remissness. As I shall be here until June, I shall hope to have the honour and pleasure of thanking you in person for your kind remembrance.
